meanings.definition: Impertinent or disrespectful in speech or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The saucy child talked back to the teacher.
meanings.sent2: She gave a saucy reply to his question.
meanings.sent3: The saucy puppy barked at the mailman.
meanings.sent4: Her saucy attitude got her in trouble with the principal.
meanings.sent5: The saucy teenager rolled their eyes at their parents.

meanings.definition: Bold or lively in a playful or cheeky way.
meanings.sent1: He wore a saucy hat to the party.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's saucy jokes had the audience laughing.
meanings.sent3: The saucy squirrel stole nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her saucy dance moves impressed everyone at the talent show.
meanings.sent5: The saucy kitten pounced on the toy mouse with glee.

meanings.definition: Having a strong or pungent flavor.
meanings.sent1: The chef added a saucy kick to the pasta sauce.
meanings.sent2: The saucy cheese made the sandwich extra tasty.
meanings.sent3: The saucy salsa made his taste buds tingle.
meanings.sent4: The saucy spices in the curry made it unforgettable.
meanings.sent5: The saucy mustard gave the hot dog a delicious zing.
